topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1 Beta: Rebuilding Instances

body.p: The rebuild operation removes all data on the server and replaces it with the specified image.
A rebuild operation always removes data injected into the file system through server personality. You can reinsert data into the file system during the rebuild.

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.

Based on whether you are working on a project or the domain:
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances tab.
Click the Project dashboard, then the Compute panel, then the Instances tab.
In the Instances table, for the instance you want to rebuild, click Edit Instance then Rebuild Instance.

In the Rebuild Instances screen:
Select the image to use to rebuild the instance. You can select the same image or rebuild using a different image.
Specify whether the instance will automatically partition, based on the image, or you will manually partition the instance.

In the confirmation screen, click Rebuild Instance.
The progress of the reboot is displayed in the Task column on the Instances screen.
